thread.title: Rain could be a factor in Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona
thread.title_full: Rain could be a factor in Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona

title: Rain could be a factor in Advance Auto Parts Clash at Daytona
text:
Feb 18, 2017 at 6:12p ET 0Shares 
Rain could be a factor in tonight’s Advance Auto Parts Clash, the 75-lap exhibition race at Daytona International Speedway that kicks off the 2017 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series season. 
The race is scheduled to begin at 8 p.m. ET, with live television coverage on FS1. 
As of 5:55 p.m. ET, the ARCA race at Daytona was in its closing stages, but rain showers were reported within 25 miles of the 2.5-mile superspeedway. 
Weather.com’s forecast calls for occasional rain tonight in Central Florida, with a consistent 35 percent chance of rain at Daytona Beach from 7 p.m. until 3 a.m. 
The good news is that if rain does fall, NASCAR has an entire fleet of its Air Titan track dryers on hand. 
We will have full coverage of tonight’s race on FOXSports.com and will update this story if weather does become a factor.
